hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Regime Transition Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 5-day historical volatility z-score (vs 90-day history) crosses above 2.0 while the 1-day put/call volume ratio exceeds 1.2, the market is transitioning from NEUTRAL to STRESS regime, and a volatility breakout strategy (long gamma/long volatility) will outperform over the next 5-10 days as realized volatility remains elevated.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The combination of sharply rising realized volatility (z-score >2) with skew toward put buying (put/call >1.2) indicates fear-driven selling and potential deleveraging, characteristic of early STRESS regime. Volatility tends to be persistent once these signals align, creating a window for long volatility strategies.
entry_conditions: Enter long volatility position: long ATM straddle 30-45 DTE

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5D HV drops below entry level by 15% (volatility fails to sustain)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 50% of signals see the regime classifier transition to STRESS within 5 days OR the median return of the long vol position is negative in the 10-day window.
